shows.title: How to Save the World from Financialisation
shows.desc:
Wit, wisdom and...economics don’t often get together in the same field. But stagnant productivity, lack of investment and rising inequality indicate that our finance-led growth economy is broken. We need deep transformation. Grace Blakeley analyses how it can be done.

Grace Blakeley is the New Statesman’s economic commentator and a research fellow at the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR).

shows.title: Green Economies
shows.desc:
Politicians seem to only to talk in terms of the costs of going green. But what about the potential jobs, techonology and innovation? What are the challenges and opportunities of steering towards a zero carbon economy? As we face the biggest societal transformation since the industrial revolution, is it possible to see a green future as an economic success rather than a sacrifice?

Economic commentator and researcher Grace Blakeley is in conversation with Rich Elliott from the Pickwell Foundation.
